QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Movement - uncontrollable
QAPair.Answer: Uncontrollable movements include many types of movements that you cannot control. They can affect the arms, legs, face, neck, or other parts of the body. Examples of uncontrollable movements are: Loss of muscle tone (flaccidity), Slow, twisting, or continued movements (chorea, athetosis, or dystonia), Sudden jerking movements (myoclonus, ballismus), Uncontrollable repetitive movements (asterixis or tremor) ,
